channel.title: Rune-evo server help, client and compiler working
channel.description:
hey, so im new at this and want to make my own server, i had a 634 server and got it running properly, however i decided to start a new server 718.
so i fixed compiler and i also got client running but i cant get my server running. heres my error.'
[Launcher] Loading DaemonScape, please wait... ERROR! THREAD NAME: main java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/jboss/netty/channel/SimpleChannelHandler at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:44) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleCha elHandler at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) ... 13 more [Launcher] Failed initing Server Channel Handler. Shutting down... Press any key to continue . . .
i want to take this server and turn it into my own but, i looked at C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin and thats as far as i get... idk where the CMD is looking, i now im probably asking a dumb question... help?

item.title: Rune-evo server help, client and compiler working
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Have you got netty libs? If not you can download them here http://netty.io/downloads.html then place them in your libs folder? and it should work

Read full topic
item.source: Rune-evo server help, client and compiler working

item.title: Rune-evo server help, client and compiler working
item.dc:creator: @daemon504 daemon504
item.description:
@daemon504 wrote:

hey, so im new at this and want to make my own server, i had a 634 server and got it running properly, however i decided to start a new server 718.

so i fixed compiler and i also got client running but i cant get my server running. heres my error.’

[Launcher] Loading DaemonScape, please wait…
ERROR! THREAD NAME: main
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/jboss/netty/channel/SimpleChannelHandler
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)

at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:44)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleCha
elHandler
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
… 13 more
[Launcher] Failed initing Server Channel Handler. Shutting down…
Press any key to continue . . .

i want to take this server and turn it into my own but, i looked at C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin and thats as far as i get… idk where the CMD is looking, i now im probably asking a dumb question… help?
